p: The main clinical manifestations of COVID-19 are respiratory, varying from a mild presentation to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), being potentially fatal. Moreover, as in other respiratory infections, pre-existing CV diseases and risk factors can increase the severity of COVID-19, leading to the aggravation and decompensation of chronic underlying cardiac pathologies as well as acute-onset of new cardiac complications [ 3], highlighting that myocardial injury can be present in approximately 12% of hospitalized patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection [ 1].
